@graph.title: With masses & arms : Peru's Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement
abstract: Inhaltsverzeichnis: A new generation needs a new name -- Gone in 90 seconds -- La Cumpa -- Capture the flag -- The alliance -- Captured -- The heroic guerrilla -- Rodrigo's journey -- Crime and punishment -- El Gordo returns -- The general's station wagon -- Freedom tunnel -- Fujishock -- Where the potatoes are cooking -- In the wolf's mouth -- The internal revolution -- The stripe-painted dog -- The one-legged chair -- Gone with the wind -- Captivity -- Chavín de Huántar -- Mary is sick!

Klappentext: "Miguel La Serna's gripping history of the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) provides vital insight into both the history of modern Peru and the link between political violence and the culture of communications in Latin America. Smaller than the well-known Shining Path but just as remarkable, the MRTA emerged in the early 1980s at the beginning of a long and bloody civil war. Taking a close look at the daily experiences of women and men who fought on both sides of the conflict, this fast-paced narrative explores the intricacies of armed action from the ground up"--
@graph.creator: gnd:1024073416
@graph.P30128: H. Eugene and Lillian Youngs Lehman series
